column4: if you want to check out what it is, check http://glue.3dn.nl
it's not the fastest site on the planet since it's at my DSL connection :-)
whats the purpouse of this project?
the purpose is described on http://wiki.3dn.nl/index.php/GLUE
the description is fairly terse however.
Either way, 'GLUE' is supposed to be a layer on top of the so many existing version control / bugtracking / SCM products.
does that make enough sense?
IDE?
yeah.. haha, text based IDE = bash
anybody have any comment/questions on GLUE ?
im not sure... what would be diffrent from, say, launchpad?
well it's not a bugtracking system OR a version control system itself.....
right... so its just a web interface?
it's supposed to be an application that keeps track of software modules, in which version control system they're kept, which bugtracking system is used for it etc.
nope, not quite. When the database is populated, GLUE should be able to use all this information to generate 'releases' coming from different repositories/bugtracking systems.
additionally, GLUE should be able to generate (automatically) things like RPM's, DEB's etc. depending on the component's settings.
am I making any sense? :-)
some. :) a more stringent description on the website, and a link to a faq, would probably be helpfull in generating more intrest :)
hey I built what I have in 4 days and I'm just cranking away at coding, I have no time to document stuff yet!
but without it, you wont have much luck recruiting, and thats what you wanted, wasnt it?
just imagine... 'glue build UBUNTU.ubuntu.org'

that should hopefully explain it better :) that command should get a list of all components in UBUNTU.ubuntu.org, for each of the components it should check all packages for open bugs, check out the revisions from the respective version control systems, and build debs!
